trans-unit.source: Configuring Application Insights SDK with ApplicationInsights.config or .xml
trans-unit.target: Configuring Application Insights SDK with ApplicationInsights.config or .xml

trans-unit.source: Enable or disable data collection modules, and add performance counters and other parameters
trans-unit.target: Enable or disable data collection modules, and add performance counters and other parameters

trans-unit.source: The Application Insights .NET SDK consists of a number of NuGet packages.
trans-unit.target: The Application Insights .NET SDK consists of a number of NuGet packages.

trans-unit.source: The <linkText>core package</linkText><title></title> provides the API for sending telemetry to the Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: The <linkText>core package</linkText><title></title> provides the API for sending telemetry to the Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: Additional packages provide telemetry modules and initializers for automatically tracking telemetry from your application and its context.
trans-unit.target: Additional packages provide telemetry modules and initializers for automatically tracking telemetry from your application and its context.

trans-unit.source: By adjusting the configuration file, you can enable or disable telemetry modules and initializers, and set parameters for some of them.
trans-unit.target: By adjusting the configuration file, you can enable or disable telemetry modules and initializers, and set parameters for some of them.

trans-unit.source: The configuration file is named ApplicationInsights.config or ApplicationInsights.xml, depending on the type of your application.
trans-unit.target: The configuration file is named ApplicationInsights.config or ApplicationInsights.xml, depending on the type of your application.

trans-unit.source: It is automatically added to your project when you <linkText>install some versions of the SDK[start]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: It is automatically added to your project when you <linkText>install some versions of the SDK[start]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: It is also added to a web app by <linkText>Status Monitor on an IIS server[redfield]</linkText><title></title>, or when you select the Appplication Insights <linkText>extension for an Azure website or VM[azure]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: It is also added to a web app by <linkText>Status Monitor on an IIS server[redfield]</linkText><title></title>, or when you select the Appplication Insights <linkText>extension for an Azure website or VM[azure]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: There isn't an equivalent file to control the <linkText>SDK in a web page[client]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: There isn't an equivalent file to control the <linkText>SDK in a web page[client]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: There's a node in the configuration file for each module.
trans-unit.target: There's a node in the configuration file for each module.

trans-unit.source: To disable a module, delete the node or comment it out.
trans-unit.target: To disable a module, delete the node or comment it out.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights NuGet package provides the following telemetry modules in the ApplicationInsights.config.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights NuGet package provides the following telemetry modules in the ApplicationInsights.config.

trans-unit.source: The DiagnosticsTelemetryModule reports errors in the Application Insights instrumenation code itself.
trans-unit.target: The DiagnosticsTelemetryModule reports errors in the Application Insights instrumenation code itself.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the code cannot access performance counters or if an ITelemetryInitializer throws an exception.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the code cannot access performance counters or if an ITelemetryInitializer throws an exception.

trans-unit.source: Trace telemetry tracked by this module appears in the <linkText>Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Trace telemetry tracked by this module appears in the <linkText>Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DependencyCollector NuGet package provides the following telemetry modules in ApplicationInsights.config.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.DependencyCollector NuGet package provides the following telemetry modules in ApplicationInsights.config.

trans-unit.source: The DependencyTrackingTelemetryModule tracks telemetry about calls to external dependencies made by your application, such as HTTP requests and SQL queries.
trans-unit.target: The DependencyTrackingTelemetryModule tracks telemetry about calls to external dependencies made by your application, such as HTTP requests and SQL queries.

trans-unit.source: To allow this module to work in an IIS server, you need to <linkText>install Status Monitor[redfield]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To allow this module to work in an IIS server, you need to <linkText>install Status Monitor[redfield]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To use it in Azure web apps or VMs, <linkText>select the Application Insights extension[azure]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To use it in Azure web apps or VMs, <linkText>select the Application Insights extension[azure]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also write your own dependency tracking code using the <linkText>TrackDependency API</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can also write your own dependency tracking code using the <linkText>TrackDependency API</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web NuGet package provides the following telemetry initializers and modules in the ApplicationInsights.config.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web NuGet package provides the following telemetry initializers and modules in the ApplicationInsights.config.

trans-unit.source: Initializers
trans-unit.target: Initializers

trans-unit.source: SyntheticTelemetryInitializer updates the User, Session and Operation contexts properties of all telemetry items tracked when handling a request from a synthetic source, such as an availability test.
trans-unit.target: SyntheticTelemetryInitializer updates the User, Session and Operation contexts properties of all telemetry items tracked when handling a request from a synthetic source, such as an availability test.

trans-unit.source: The Application Insights portal does not display synthetic telemetry by default.
trans-unit.target: The Application Insights portal does not display synthetic telemetry by default.

trans-unit.source: ClientIpHeaderTelemetryInitializer updates Ip property of the Location context of all telemetry items based on the X-Forwarded-For HTTP header of the request.
trans-unit.target: ClientIpHeaderTelemetryInitializer updates Ip property of the Location context of all telemetry items based on the X-Forwarded-For HTTP header of the request.

trans-unit.source: UserAgentTelemetryInitializer updates the UserAgent property of the User context of all telemetry items based on the User-Agent HTTP header of the request.
trans-unit.target: UserAgentTelemetryInitializer updates the UserAgent property of the User context of all telemetry items based on the User-Agent HTTP header of the request.

trans-unit.source: OperationNameTelemetryInitializer updates the Name property of the RequestTelemetry and the Name property of the Operation context of all telemetry items based on the HTTP method, as well as names of ASP.NET MVC controller and action invoked to process the request.
trans-unit.target: OperationNameTelemetryInitializer updates the Name property of the RequestTelemetry and the Name property of the Operation context of all telemetry items based on the HTTP method, as well as names of ASP.NET MVC controller and action invoked to process the request.

trans-unit.source: OperationNameTelemetryInitializer updates the 'Operation.Id context property of all telemetry items tracked while handling a request with the automatically generated RequestTelemetry.Id`.
trans-unit.target: OperationNameTelemetryInitializer updates the 'Operation.Id context property of all telemetry items tracked while handling a request with the automatically generated RequestTelemetry.Id`.

trans-unit.source: UserTelemetryInitializer updates the Id and AcquisitionDate properties of User context for all telemetry items with values extracted from the ai_user cookie generated by the Application Insights JavaScript instrumentation code running in the user's browser.
trans-unit.target: UserTelemetryInitializer updates the Id and AcquisitionDate properties of User context for all telemetry items with values extracted from the ai_user cookie generated by the Application Insights JavaScript instrumentation code running in the user's browser.

trans-unit.source: SessionTelemetryInitializer updates the Id property of the Session context for all telemetry items with value extracted from the ai_session cookie generated by the ApplicationInsights JavaScript instrumentation code running in the user's browser.
trans-unit.target: SessionTelemetryInitializer updates the Id property of the Session context for all telemetry items with value extracted from the ai_session cookie generated by the ApplicationInsights JavaScript instrumentation code running in the user's browser.

trans-unit.source: AzureRoleEnvironmentTelemetryInitializer updates the RoleName and RoleInstance properties of the Device context for all telemetry items with information extracted from the Azure runtime environment.
trans-unit.target: AzureRoleEnvironmentTelemetryInitializer updates the RoleName and RoleInstance properties of the Device context for all telemetry items with information extracted from the Azure runtime environment.

trans-unit.source: DomainNameRoleInstanceTelemetryInitializer updates the RoleInstance property of the Device context for all telemetry items with the domain name of the computer where the web application is running.
trans-unit.target: DomainNameRoleInstanceTelemetryInitializer updates the RoleInstance property of the Device context for all telemetry items with the domain name of the computer where the web application is running.

trans-unit.source: BuildInfoConfigComponentVersionTelemetryInitializer updates the Version property of the Component context for all telemetry items with the value extracted from the BuildInfo.config file produced by TFS build.
trans-unit.target: BuildInfoConfigComponentVersionTelemetryInitializer updates the Version property of the Component context for all telemetry items with the value extracted from the BuildInfo.config file produced by TFS build.

trans-unit.source: DeviceTelemetryInitializer updates the following properties of the Device context for all telemetry items.
trans-unit.target: DeviceTelemetryInitializer updates the following properties of the Device context for all telemetry items.

trans-unit.source: Type is set to "PC"
trans-unit.target: Type is set to "PC"

trans-unit.source: Id is set to the domain name of the computer where the web application is running.
trans-unit.target: Id is set to the domain name of the computer where the web application is running.

trans-unit.source: OemName is set to the value extracted from the Win32_ComputerSystem.Manufacturer field using WMI.
trans-unit.target: OemName is set to the value extracted from the Win32_ComputerSystem.Manufacturer field using WMI.

trans-unit.source: Model is set to the value extracted from the Win32_ComputerSystem.Model field using WMI.
trans-unit.target: Model is set to the value extracted from the Win32_ComputerSystem.Model field using WMI.

trans-unit.source: NetworkType is set to the value extracted from the NetworkInterface.
trans-unit.target: NetworkType is set to the value extracted from the NetworkInterface.

trans-unit.source: Language is set to the name of the CurrentCulture.
trans-unit.target: Language is set to the name of the CurrentCulture.

trans-unit.source: Modules
trans-unit.target: Modules

trans-unit.source: RequestTrackingTelemetryModule tracks requests received by your web app and measures the response times.
trans-unit.target: RequestTrackingTelemetryModule tracks requests received by your web app and measures the response times.

trans-unit.source: ExceptionTrackingTelemetryModule tracks unhandled exceptions in your web app.
trans-unit.target: ExceptionTrackingTelemetryModule tracks unhandled exceptions in your web app.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Failures and exceptions[exceptions]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Failures and exceptions[exceptions]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: DeveloperModeWithDebuggerAttachedTelemetryModule forces the Application Insights TelemetryChannel to send data immediately, one telemetry item at a time, when a debugger is attached to the application process.
trans-unit.target: DeveloperModeWithDebuggerAttachedTelemetryModule forces the Application Insights TelemetryChannel to send data immediately, one telemetry item at a time, when a debugger is attached to the application process.

trans-unit.source: This reduces the amount of time between the moment when your application tracks telemetry and when it appears on the Application Insights portal at the cost of significant CPU and network bandwidth overhead.
trans-unit.target: This reduces the amount of time between the moment when your application tracks telemetry and when it appears on the Application Insights portal at the cost of significant CPU and network bandwidth overhead.

trans-unit.source: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.PerfCounterCollector NuGet package adds the following telemetry modules to the ApplicationInsights.config by default.
trans-unit.target: The Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.PerfCounterCollector NuGet package adds the following telemetry modules to the ApplicationInsights.config by default.

trans-unit.source: PerformanceCollectorModule tracks a number of Windows performance counters.
trans-unit.target: PerformanceCollectorModule tracks a number of Windows performance counters.

trans-unit.source: You can see these counters when you click a chart in Metric Explorer to open its details blade.
trans-unit.target: You can see these counters when you click a chart in Metric Explorer to open its details blade.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor additional performance counters - both standard Windows counters and any others that you have added.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor additional performance counters - both standard Windows counters and any others that you have added.

trans-unit.source: Use the following syntax to collect additional performance counters:
trans-unit.target: Use the following syntax to collect additional performance counters:

trans-unit.source: PerformanceCounter must be either \CategoryName(InstanceName)\CounterName or \CategoryName\CounterName
trans-unit.target: PerformanceCounter must be either \CategoryName(InstanceName)\CounterName or \CategoryName\CounterName

trans-unit.source: If you provide a ReportAs attribute, this will be used as the name displayed in Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: If you provide a ReportAs attribute, this will be used as the name displayed in Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: For reporting to Application Insights, counter names must include only: letters, round brackets, forward slashes, hyphens, underscores, spaces and dots.
trans-unit.target: For reporting to Application Insights, counter names must include only: letters, round brackets, forward slashes, hyphens, underscores, spaces and dots.

trans-unit.source: You must use ReportAs if the counter you want to monitor contains any invalid characters such as '#' or digits.
trans-unit.target: You must use ReportAs if the counter you want to monitor contains any invalid characters such as '#' or digits.

trans-unit.source: The following placeholders are supported as InstanceName:
trans-unit.target: The following placeholders are supported as InstanceName:

trans-unit.source: These parameters affect how the Java SDK should store and flush the telemetry data that it collects.
trans-unit.target: These parameters affect how the Java SDK should store and flush the telemetry data that it collects.

trans-unit.source: The number of telemetry items that can be stored in the SDK's in-memory storage.
trans-unit.target: The number of telemetry items that can be stored in the SDK's in-memory storage.

trans-unit.source: When this number is reached, the telemetry buffer is flushed - that is, the telemetry items are sent to the Application Insights server.
trans-unit.target: When this number is reached, the telemetry buffer is flushed - that is, the telemetry items are sent to the Application Insights server.

trans-unit.source: Min: 1
trans-unit.target: Min: 1

trans-unit.source: Default: 500
trans-unit.target: Default: 500

trans-unit.source: Determines how often the data that is stored in the in-memory storage should be flushed (sent to Application Insights).
trans-unit.target: Determines how often the data that is stored in the in-memory storage should be flushed (sent to Application Insights).

trans-unit.source: Min: 1
trans-unit.target: Min: 1

trans-unit.source: Max: 300
trans-unit.target: Max: 300

trans-unit.source: Default: 5
trans-unit.target: Default: 5

trans-unit.source: Determines the maximum size in MB that is allotted to the persistent storage on the local disk.
trans-unit.target: Determines the maximum size in MB that is allotted to the persistent storage on the local disk.

trans-unit.source: This storage is used for persisting telemetry items that failed to be transmitted to the Application Insights endpoint.
trans-unit.target: This storage is used for persisting telemetry items that failed to be transmitted to the Application Insights endpoint.

trans-unit.source: When the storage size has been met, new telemetry items will be discarded.
trans-unit.target: When the storage size has been met, new telemetry items will be discarded.

trans-unit.source: Min: 1
trans-unit.target: Min: 1

trans-unit.source: Max: 100
trans-unit.target: Max: 100

trans-unit.source: Default: 10
trans-unit.target: Default: 10

trans-unit.source: If the standard initializers aren't suitable for your application, you can create your own.
trans-unit.target: If the standard initializers aren't suitable for your application, you can create your own.

trans-unit.source: Use Context Initializers to set values that will be used to initialize every telemetry client.
trans-unit.target: Use Context Initializers to set values that will be used to initialize every telemetry client.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have published more than one version of your app, you could make sure you can separate the data by filtering on a custom property:
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have published more than one version of your app, you could make sure you can separate the data by filtering on a custom property:

trans-unit.source: Use Telemetry Initializers to add processing to each event.
trans-unit.target: Use Telemetry Initializers to add processing to each event.

trans-unit.source: For example, the web SDK flags as failed any request with a response code >= 400.
trans-unit.target: For example, the web SDK flags as failed any request with a response code >= 400.

trans-unit.source: You could override that behavior:
trans-unit.target: You could override that behavior:

trans-unit.source: To install your initializers, add lines in ApplicationInsights.config:
trans-unit.target: To install your initializers, add lines in ApplicationInsights.config:

trans-unit.source: Alternatively you can write code to install the initializer at an early point in execution of your application.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively you can write code to install the initializer at an early point in execution of your application.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: This determines the Application Insights resource in which your data appears.
trans-unit.target: This determines the Application Insights resource in which your data appears.

trans-unit.source: Typically you create a separate resource, with a separate key, for each of your applications.
trans-unit.target: Typically you create a separate resource, with a separate key, for each of your applications.

trans-unit.source: If you want to set the key dynamically - for example if you want to send results from your application to different resources - you can omit the key from the configuration file, and set it in code instead.
trans-unit.target: If you want to set the key dynamically - for example if you want to send results from your application to different resources - you can omit the key from the configuration file, and set it in code instead.

trans-unit.source: To set the key for all instances of TelemetryClient, including standard telemetry modules, set the key in TelemetryConfiguration.Active.
trans-unit.target: To set the key for all instances of TelemetryClient, including standard telemetry modules, set the key in TelemetryConfiguration.Active.

trans-unit.source: Do this in an initialization method, such as global.aspx.cs in an ASP.NET service:
trans-unit.target: Do this in an initialization method, such as global.aspx.cs in an ASP.NET service:

trans-unit.source: If you just want to send a specific set of events to a different resource, you can set the key for a specific TelemetryClient:
trans-unit.target: If you just want to send a specific set of events to a different resource, you can set the key for a specific TelemetryClient:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Learn more about the API[api]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Learn more about the API[api]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To get a new key, <linkText>create a new resource in the Application Insights portal[new]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To get a new key, <linkText>create a new resource in the Application Insights portal[new]</linkText><title></title>.
